title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Vill du jobba i ett företag med både hjärta och hjärna som satsar mycket på IT? Vill du forma innovativa och smarta IT-lösningar i agila team som skapar trygghet och värde för våra kunder? Just nu fokuserar vi på digitalisering av kundmötet, utveckling av morgondagens försäkringssystem och förflyttning mot publika molntjänster.



Datadomänen söker nu ytterligare två Cloud Infrastructure Engineers. Läs mer och skicka in din ansökan om du vill vara med på Folksams molnresa!


**Det här gör du som Cloud Infrastructure Engineer på Folksam**
---------------------------------------------------------------



Du arbetar i en spännande roll med att utveckla, förbättra och automatisera vår nyetablerade analyticsplattform i Azure. I detta ingår till exempel att utveckla ny funktionalitet, etablera pipelines för DevOps och automatisera dessa. Därutöver ständigt jobba med automatisering för att underlätta underhållet av plattformen.



Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella agila team där ditt team består av flera Cloud Infrastructure Engineers, testledare och Delivery Lead. Du är med och möjliggör innovativ och ny teknik som till exempel Databricks, Terraform, Azure RedHat Openshift samt andra Azure-tjänster som är vanliga inom analys och DW.



Vill du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba på Folksam? Klicka dig in här så kan du läsa intervjuer där de berättar om sina jobb.


**Är du den vi söker?**
-----------------------



Här söker vi sig som vill vara med och forma Folksams fortsatta resa mot molnet och framtidens AI/ML-lösningar? Som Cloud Infrastructure Engineer inom Datadomänen spelar du en nyckelroll i att bygga och vidareutveckla vår moderna, automatiserade plattform. Du har därför ett starkt intresse för DevOps, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), den senaste tekniken inom Azure, Big Data, scriptning och systemutveckling.



Vi söker dig som är initiativtagande, nyfiken och trivs med att arbeta nära verksamheten. Du gillar att lära dig nytt, dela med dig av din kunskap och bidra till ett team där samarbete och innovation står i centrum.



Vi tror att du har:


* En högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, informationsvetenskap, ingenjörsutbildning eller motsvarande.
* Ett genuint teknikintresse och drivs av att skapa lösningar med hög kvalitet och hög grad av automation.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


Meriterande erfarenheter (men inte krav – nyfikenhet och vilja att lära väger tungt):


* Infrastructure as Code: t.ex. Terraform, ARM Templates eller Bicep
* Scriptning och automatisering med Bash, Python eller liknande språk
* Linux-systemadministration
* DevOps-verktyg och ramverk: Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins eller motsvarande
* Nätverkskunskap: grundläggande routing, DNS och protokoll
* Containerteknologier: OpenShift, Docker, Azure
* Big Data-teknologier: Apache Spark, NoSQL-databaser, distribuerade filsystem
* Erfarenhet eller intresse för AI/ML-plattformar och verktyg, t.ex. Azure Machine Learning, MLflow, eller liknande


Du är en problemlösare som gillar att tänka utanför boxen, automatisera processer och arbeta nära våra produktionssystem i en DevOps-miljö.


**Här kan du göra skillnad**
----------------------------



Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.  

  

Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.



Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.


**Så söker du jobbet**
----------------------



Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast 3 september 2025.



Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta avdelningschef Henrik Nose 070-831 52 82, henrik.nose@folksam.se eller Delivery Lead Mikael Isenberg 072-156 90 05 mikael.isenberg@folksam.se.



Fackliga representanter: Akademikerföreningen Per Hansson 070-831 60 67, Forena Morgan Svensson 073-423 59 12 och Handels Mikael Karlsson 070-831 51 32.


*Kundägda Folksamgruppen erbjuder sparande och försäkringar som ger trygghet i livets alla skeden. Sedan 1908 gör vi det enklare för våra fyra miljoner kunder att känna sig trygga i en hållbar värld genom rätt försäkringar, rätt sparande och rätt hjälp när något händer.*

title: Digital Product Owner
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


At Volvo Group Digital & IT, we have a clear ambition to enable value creation at scale for the Volvo Group. With a new product centric operating model and digital technologies, we will produce digital offerings that are profitable, scalable, and differentiated. With Volvo Group Digital & IT, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals, who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead. We have a very important role to play in reaching the Volvo Group ambitions for 2030. Do you want to be part of our transformation journey towards becoming the digital capability of the Group? The time is now.

 **This will be us - your new colleagues within Foundational Products**


Foundational Products is part of Technology, a new function within Volvo Group Digital & IT with a big stake in the Group’s digital transformation. Technology will modernize Volvo’s core digital backbone making it a platform for digital products.


Foundational Products are responsible for API & Integration, DevSecOps, Cloud and Development Platforms. Our Foundational IT products are used by digital product teams and enable them and their products to outperform Volvo’s competitors. Our digital talents develop capabilities and digital technologies to improve business performance and create value for the Group with speed and at scale.


We collaborate with other parts of the organization, both in Group IT, with TD/BAs and Group Functions. We foster an environment where ideas, thoughts and opinions can be shared. We are team players with clear common ambitions, and we win together.

**Who are you?**
----------------

**The Cloud Foundational Product is now looking for a Senior Cloud Engineer**  

In this role you will be reporting to the Manager Cloud Adoption within Foundational Product Cloud. The Cloud team has the responsibility for driving the development of the Cloud product portfolio by identifying and prioritizing requirements and working closely with Infrastructure & Onsite Services who oversees the technical development. This team is also in charge of the Cloud adoption across the Digital & IT community.

 **This is how you can make an impact**  

We are looking for an energetic person that will be able to work as part of our internal Cloud Adoption Team.  

You will spend 50% of your time as a Digital Product Owner, responsible for turning the product roadmap into working deliverables in your team backlog, aligned with the overall strategy and product vision. You will manage the team backlog, ensuring it is visible, transparent, and understood. You will manage dependencies and collaborate with other teams and business partners as needed. You will secure that SLAs are established and fulfilled end-to-end for any solutions managed by the team. You will secure that the team regularly collects feedback on implemented work and contributes to Cloud Adoption product roadmap and capacity planning. You will be responsible for team and culture development to secure proper capacity and capability for its delivery.  

The remaining 50% of your time will be dedicated to activities that leverage your unique skills and experience. If you have expertise in Azure Cloud or Kubernetes/OpenShift, you may provide technical guidance and hands-on involvement in complex or demanding projects. Alternatively, you could lead side projects, develop Power BI solutions, or contribute in other ways that align with your strengths and the team's needs. Your role will be tailored to maximize your impact and support the team's objectives.

**Who are you?**  

 To be successful in this position, we believe you have:  

* At least 5 years of experience working as a digital product owner or in a similar role.
* Experience in managing team backlogs and aligning deliverables with product vision and strategy.
* Experience of working with Agile / Scrum
* Proven communication, presentation, and writing skills including the ability to write clear and comprehensive technical documentation.
* Deep understanding of cloud technologies (Azure) and adoption strategies.
* Ability to provide technical guidance and hands-on involvement in complex or demanding projects.
* Ability to translate company directives into tangible technical requirements.
* Fluency in English.
 **Nice to have**  

* Experience with Agile development workflow and DevOps way of working and tools.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or other).
* Experience with Azure PowerShell and scripting (e.g., Python or Bash).
* Experience with Data analysis / Power BI
* FinOps framework understanding or hands on FinOps experience.
  

**If you are:**  

* Passionate about technology, and have interest in emerging tools, trends and techniques across the industry.
* Friendly, approachable, and collaborative team player who enjoys working with people from across the company
* Problem solver, comfortable taking the initiative in challenging and ambiguous circumstances

Please join our team to make your mark on how one of the largest automotive companies in the world is making a shift to cloud. By that you can also have an impact on the future of transportation and automotive industry.

 **Are we a good match?**


To achieve our goals, we collaborate within and across teams. We create a sense of unity and trust by nurturing open dialogues and collective work. We build a work environment where diversity in expertise, opinion and culture is valued.

 **Flexible locations :**  

* Poland,Wrocław,dolnośląskie
* India,Bangalore,Karnataka
* France,Lyon,Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
* Sweden,Göteborg,Västra Götaland
  

Travel Required: Occasional Travel

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Solutions Architect, Software and Technology companies
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?  

  

Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower Software, SaaS and Technology companies to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.  

  

Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organisations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.  

  

They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.  

Amongst others you will be part of designing and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and help customers deploy production workloads on AWS. You will provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernisation and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.  

  

Come build the future with us.  

  

At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.  

  

Amazon has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.  

  

AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and dedicated support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Work directly with strategic customers to accelerate their challenging, mission-critical projects and recommend best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business outcomes
* Build technical relationships with customers and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
* Share the voice of the customer to inform the roadmap of AWS features.
* Participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
* Evangelise and educate customers about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
* Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organisation by interviewing candidates and having a voice in hiring decisions. You will also be helping others develop new skills by mentoring team members and identifying talent needs in the organisation.
* Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to our outcomes.

  

About the team  

Our Solutions Architecture team empowers innovators to invent on behalf of customers. We are obsessed with understanding each customer's unique objectives to deliver optimal architectures tailored to their needs. Our culture celebrates talented, curious, motivated team members who take ownership of projects. We move with urgency, take risks, learn continuously, and maintain a friendly, inclusive environment. Join our team if you are passionate about technology and delighting customers.  

  

Your direct team is located across the Nordics and you would work in close collaboration with team members across borders.
  

  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

  

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, or DevOps
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A passion for technology and for learning

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating IT systems in the cloud
* Working knowledge of software development practices and technologies highly desired
* AWS Certification, eg. AWS Solutions Architect Associate

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Electronic Arts Information Technology (EAIT) group keeps our employees and business operations connected globally. As a digital entertainment company, EA’s enterprise technology needs are diverse and span across game development, workforce collaboration, marketing, publishing, player experience, security, and corporate activities. We bring creative technology services to each one of these areas, keeping everyone creative, collaborative and productive. Our team ensures better play across all of EA and needs your help to do that.
   

  

 We are the IT team supporting AAA game development in a highly collaborative environment at our DICE studio in central Stockholm. Join us in powering the future of play alongside the teams behind Battlefield, Frostbite and many more.
   

  

 We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Site IT Infrastructure team.
   

  

 As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and supporting the IT infrastructure, ensuring the reliability and efficiency of compute, storage, and network systems. This role is a full-time, hybrid position based in Stockholm, with both remote and onsite work, where you will be reporting to the Senior Site IT Manager.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Implementation and administration of data center hardware.
* Overseeing, managing, and optimizing virtualization platforms.
* Monitor and maintain the datacenter environment.
* Managing enterprise networking and basic troubleshooting.
* Respond to and resolve service outages and alert events efficiently to support business operations.
* Be part of a rotating on-call schedule for infrastructure support.
* Provide technical support to employees on both hardware and software issues.
* Procurement of infrastructure hardware, management of service agreements, and tracking of asset inventory.
* Work closely with global teams to deliver consistent IT services to our users.
* Maintain relationships with the business, vendors, and other functions.
* Ensure documentation is thoroughly maintained and regularly updated.
* Managing and allocating budgets for IT resources and projects.


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of infrastructure experience in the IT industry.
* Extensive experience with servers, storage systems, and virtualization.
* Knowledge of Windows Server and Linux operating systems.
* Basic understanding of networking and network administration.
* Experience with containers, scripting and automation tools is a plus but not required.
* Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Ability to prioritize, coordinate, and organize tasks effectively.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experience with project and budget management.
* Strong documentation skills, including the ability to create guides and articles.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
